data.title: The 14 Best Timbaland Songs Ever, Ranked
data.meta_description: Timbaland songs are like no other; words can't fully do a justice in describing his musical prowess. Here are his 14 best.
data.text:
Getty Images

Timbaland songs are like no other; words can't fully do a justice in describing his musical prowess. When it comes to blending infectious rhythms, groundbreaking beats, and an unmistakable signature sound, few can stand on the same pedestal as Timothy Zachary Mosley, known worldwide as Timbaland. This legendary producer and rapper has given us some of the most iconic tracks of the last few decades, crafting unique soundscapes for artists like Missy Elliott, Justin Timberlake, Nelly Furtado, and more. But which of his many hits stand out the most? Here, we dive into the best Timbaland songs, showcasing his mastery in creating auditory addiction.

RELATED: The 25 Best Albums of the 90s, Ranked

14. "Morning After Dark" (feat. Nelly Furtado, SoShy)

Year Released: 2009

The gothic-tinged "Morning After Dark," highlights Timbaland's versatility, diving into a supernatural theme, accompanied by the distinct vocal textures of Nelly Furtado and SoShy. This track's pulsating energy promises to keep listeners hooked from dusk till dawn.

13. "Throw It on Me" (feat. The Hives)

Year Released: 2007

Pairing with rock band The Hives, "Throw It On Me" showcases a collision of genres, proving that Timbaland's prowess isn't limited to hip-hop and R&B. The result? One of the best Timbaland songs with an electrifying, rock-infused vibe.

12. "Say Something" (feat. Drake)

Year Released: 2010

"Say Something" utilizes minimalist beats to create an intimate atmosphere, allowing the heartfelt lyrics and Drake's smooth flow to shine. Itâ€™s a testament to Timbaland's ability to produce hits that resonate on a deeper emotional level.

11. "If We Ever Meet Again" (feat. Katy Perry)

Year Released: 2009

In "If We Ever Meet Again," Timbaland pairs with pop sensation Katy Perry to create a melodic and catchy tune that melds his rhythmic genius with pure pop perfection. The synergy between the two artists is palpable, making it one of the best Timbaland songs for any playlist.

10. "Promiscuous" (with Nelly Furtado)

Year Released: 2006

"Promiscuous" is a playful back-and-forth dialogue set to an irresistible beat, marking one of the best Timbaland songs that defined the mid-2000s. Nelly Furtado's sultry vocals paired with Timbaland's smooth rap sections create a flirty, unforgettable track.

9. "Scream" (with Keri Hilson and Nicole Scherzinger)

Year Released: 2007

"Scream," with its sensual overtones and smooth, pulse-pounding rhythm, stands out in Timbaland's repertoire. Keri Hilson and Nicole Scherzinger's powerful vocals are front and center, driven by Timbaland's impeccable production.

8. "Carry Out" (feat. Justin Timberlake)

Year Released: 2009

"Carry Out" has Timbaland and Justin Timberlake delivering a catchy, metaphor-laden track that you can't help but groove to. Its playful lyrics and smooth beats showcase the chemistry between the two, securing its spot among the best Timbaland songs.

7. "The Way I Are" (feat. Keri Hilson, D.O.E., Sebastian)

Year Released: 2007

With "The Way I Are," Timbaland strikes a balance between electronic influences and his signature hip-hop style, creating an anthem of acceptance and raw attraction. It's a track that pulls you in and compels you to dance, no questions asked.

6. "Get Ur Freak On" (with Missy Elliott)

Year Released: 2001

"Get Ur Freak On" is a masterpiece where Timbaland's production genius underpins Missy Elliott's dynamic flow. With its unmistakable beat and innovative sound, it's no surprise that this track remains one of the best Timbaland songs ever produced.

5. "Cry Me A River" (with Justin Timberlake)

Year Released: 2002

The emotionally charged "Cry Me a River," produced by Timbaland, features haunting melodies that perfectly complement Justin Timberlake's tale of heartbreak and betrayal. Its storytelling power and complex harmonies solidify its place in musical history.

4. "Dirt Off Your Shoulder" (with Jay-Z)

Year Released: 2003

"Dirt Off Your Shoulder" has Timbaland pulling out all the stops with a beat that's as confident and cool as Jay-Z's delivery. This track isn't just a song; it's an anthem for resilience and swag, making it one of the best Timbaland songs for motivation.

3. "One in a Million" (with Aaliyah)

Year Released: 1996

Timbaland's production on Aaliyah's "One in a Million" redefined R&B, with its futuristic soundscapes and smooth beats. This song isn't just a track; it's a timeless classic that continues to influence modern music.

2. "Apologize" (with OneRepublic)

Year Released: 2007

"Apologize" sees Timbaland exploring the realm of pop-rock with OneRepublic, and the result is nothing short of iconic. The track's poignant lyrics and unforgettable melody make it one of the best Timbaland songs, continuing to resonate with listeners worldwide.

1. "Give It to Me" (with Nelly Furtado, Justin Timberlake)

Year Released: 2007

Topping our list is "Give It To Me," a confident, braggadocious track that boasts not only a star-studded lineup but also some of the sharpest production and catchiest hooks in music history. It encapsulates the best of Timbaland's monumental career, from his innovative beats to his ability to bring out the best in his collaborators.
